text:
I experiencing this too. When I look at this problem, I'm trying to figure out why `scope_to_list` is returning `None` when scope is `None`. https://github.com/idan/oauthlib/blob/master/oauthlib/oauth2/rfc6749/utils.py#L41-L42

Wouldn't it be better to return an empty list?
title: nan

text: @asteinlein `git blame` indicates that you wrote the code that make `scope_to_list` return `None` when the scope is `None`. Do you recall why you did that instead of returning an empty list?
title: nan

text:
However, this doesn't fix #306 for me. If a Oauth2 server doesn't return the a scope on the response, then it assumed it changed. The Oauth2 may not return a scope in the response if it didn't change which scope was requested. More info on #306 as well. 

I am not sure why but another person I know using Google + flask-oauthlib doesn't get this error but I can create it 100% of the time.
title: nan

text: I worked around this issue for MailChimp in particular using a compliance fix at the OAuth client level in requests-oauthlib.  If you're stuck and don't have the luxury of waiting on a release, you can host the compliance fixes in your own code.
title: nan

text: This pull request doesn't actually fix the problems people are having with google oauth2. #323 does.
title: nan

text: I think Travis might be failing because #322 needs to be merged (pyjwt is not pinned to any particular version).
title: nan
